comments.commentBody: Could you repeat that please.

Either way, releasing this doesn't help him. If there was a wire tap, and we don't know because it is illegal for anyone except the president to confirm this, then a FISA judge approved it based on some level of actionable evidence. [not helpful to him] If there was no wire tap, he is a liar. [not helpful to him]. Lose-Lose. His impulse control is so poor -- he would have been much better off being silent about this. What is absolutely true is that Obama did not approve this -- the president doesn't have the power to do that -- that part is a true lie.
Dr. m surely you know better than to trust Trump or his  personal TV station. Investigate .
Kind of like the allegations of Trump's Russian involvement.  Still no evidence.  Just democrats generating anger toward and distrust of Trump.

It's almost as if he made up something absolutely insane in hopes that reputable news sources would put it at the top of their main page instead of a story showing ample evidence that multiple members of his administration committed treason during the election cycle.

Way to go, NYTimes.
Don't worry, The Times can report on more than one story at a time.

Yes, this may be true. And, if necessary there is an amendment to the Constitution that can come into play. But, are his minions heading the executive departments willing to take action, if necessary? I doubt it. I never, ever thought I would say this: I fear a military coup.

Another point: People fear domestic police forces but at least they are trained to serve the public, even if they fail at times. ICE is not trained this way. Police are not to arrest without probable cause. ICE has much broader powers in deporting undocumented persons. Trump perceives, and has termed, his immigration enforcement as a military operation. The military are precluded from policing the US. The National Guuard is called out only in emergencies--natural and man-made. They patrolled the streets of Baltimore during and after the April 2015 riots. Once their job was complete, they demobilized. ICEdoes not even have this discipline or role. What has Trump unleashed?

At this point it's not a fake news, but a grave mental health issue. According to the muddied 25th Amendment, only the Vice President, the President's cabinet and certain members of Congress can intervene based on mental incapacity. Obviously, they show no intention of doing so.

If I were a member of his family, I would call the police (or petition the courts if necessary) to have him put on a minimum 72-hour psychiatric hold for his own safety. According to a myriad of mental health experts, his behavioral health dam shows every sign of bursting. He needs treatment, and he needs it now.
Never.

The media treats every enunciation by this man as if it reflects what he thinks. Don't you see that he doesn't particularly think or understand anything? I read about accusations, and policies, and policy reversals --- this clown does not have policies or positions or reversals. He just shoots his mouth off.

You give him way too much credit by reacting as if there is some complex web of ideas his brain. This latest nonsense about Obama is just that --- nonsense. Trump has a bully's need to be noticed and talked about, and boy has the media obliged, since the very start of his ridiculous candidacy.

I also read that Trump is mentally ill. I think that makes him sound more complicated than he is. He is just an extremely limited, stupid, ignorant man who is driven by money and lust, and who sees the world in terms of how much it can stroke his ego. It's not original. It's not interesting. He says dumb things. He embarrasses himself. He has no clue how society works, nor how politics works. He just has no clue.

When you write that he is shaking things up and breaking with protocol, don't you understand that this is exactly what he wants, and exactly why his supporters admire him? In fact, he is not doing anything except saying whatever pops into his small mind at an given moment.

This man is no revolutionary. He is no subversive. Revolutionaries and subversives have clear agendas and a vision, whether one agrees with that vision or not. Trump has nothing.
Nail on the head!
Very well stated and makes perfect sense. We're overthinking it, something of which Trump has never been guilty. He is driven by simple impulses, not complex thoughts.
Brilliant.
Sorry 45...we're on to you. Clearly he's attempting another ridiculous distraction to keep the medal chasing nonsense instead of watching what he's up to right now. It's not working babe.

I would imagine Trump's unexplainable adoration of the murderer Putin has long had the attention of all people concerned with our sovereignty and safety as a nation. Thank God someone was tapping the Russian ambassador's phone or Flynn would still be there. Our new Attorney General was recently caught lying under oath when asked about communications with Russia. There will likely be no consequences. If that had been Hillary Clinton I wonder if it would be swept under the rug in the same manner.

The only way anyone is going to hear the the truth from these people is clandestinely.

Trump has jumped the shark.
Time to cancel his presidency.

It's always someone else's fault, isn't it? With the raid on Yemen. First, it was really an Obama thing. Trump simply went along. Then it was the fault of the generals, all great generals, but nonetheless, they're responsible. Then it wasn't a failure after all. Scads of vital intelligence was obtained. Of course, all of the intelligence is classified, but trust us, the death of a soldier was worth it. And while we're at it, let's bring his widow to tears at the end of his congressional speech.
Now we find out that all of President Trump's Russian troubles are the result of President Obama. Bugging his phones. President Obama, the guy who isn't really an American. Wasn't really born here.
How much of this garbage are we supposed to eat?

If we are to believe the Republican and Corporatist Democrat line that mass shootings and murders are caused by mental illness, when Trump presses that big shiny red button and obliterates several million, will politicians finally come together and do the right thing? Put trump in prison where he belongs? I mean, I know the answer is "no". He's beyond rich. They'll probably give him a participation award and a gold-plated golf-cart to ride around after the fact.

In the mean-time, anyone committing a mass-shooting will be labeled a terrorist or mentally ill and thrust into prison and torture or wrapped up in a straight-jacket and heavily medicated.

It's a darn good thing there are several sets of rules and laws on the books depending upon your wealth, social status, sex, and skin color.

Take away his money and power, keep the lawsuits he's been in and throw in a couple of (maybe 10) restraining orders that anyone else doing what he did would have been hit with, and Trump couldn't get a job at a fastfood joint with his background. Unless he lied about his background. Which he would. But president? That's cool.

If Twitter has even an ounce of conscience left, it would shut down Mr. Trump's account since he has a persistent pattern of spreading FAKE NEWS in uncontrollable manners. Isn't that the initiatives of all relevant social media now - to tackle and filter FAKE NEWS?
And for the final act tonight, comedian, conspirator, and POTUS, DJT! Warning: it's gonna be painful!

YES, THIS! I was SICK of how the media fawned over Trump the other night...saying that "AMERICA" was bearing witness to Ryan Owens' wife's pain. Yes, her pain is horrible but what about Trump's decision to send Owens on that mission -- and blaming the generals? How will Trump make it up to the Owens family? I don't think they care about how many minutes Trump got a standing ovation.

And what an ovation from the media! Suddenly he has become a PRESIDENT because he read words on a teleprompter! The man has the charisma and the voice to sell. He is a SALESMAN. So this is not a big surprise that he can read a speech. Van Jones, give me a break.

This morning, Trump was probably alone with just his phone and needed to speak to America through his preferred device, Twitter. What does he care about? Demeaning Obama and his beloved Apprentice.

DONALD, PLEASE RETURN TO THE APPRENTICE. I WILL WATCH IT EVERY WEEK.

The GOP takes us over a cliff with their plans costing us more while we all get less. GOP seeks tax cuts for the rich, & benefit cuts for the poor & middle class . This is foolish since there's a real solution, Medicare for All. If GOP politicians weren't so blinded by ideology & unaware of failed policies proven by the last 25-plus years’ experience, they'd realize these failures are still in the GOP's supposed “better way.” They seem unaware of recent public polls favoring single-payer, regardless of political party.

Republican replacement programs contain huge benefits for corporations & the very rich. With repeal, an average of $33,000 of tax cuts goes to the richest 1% this year, & $197,000 of tax cuts to the top 0.1 %. 400 highest-income taxpayers (incomes more than $300 million each) receive annual tax cuts of about $7 million. Also increased are taxes on families earning between $10,000 & $75,000 – including most of GOP's working class voters.

With GOP repeal, 32 million people lose their health insurance, tens of thousands of Americans die because of lack of medical care they need, Medicare becomes worse , the rich becoming far richer.

The sanctimonious, hypocritical Tea Party-Trump-Paul Ryan-GOP plans to wholly abandon the interests of their own voters & become unapologetic forces for the wealthiest members of society. GOP proposals shower huge benefits on rich Americans & leave the rest of us, including most of their own constituency, in the lurch.
Add paranoia to Trump's troubling personality profile.
Name your sources!
the main source is Donald Trump's twitter account
Usually it is his "very good brain".
Actually, his phones were not tapped.  His gold plated toilets were tapped, as the only honest thing that emerges from Trump is from that end of his anatomy.

The pattern is clear: an enormous embarrassment occurs (Trump's AG is caught lying under oath). Trump responds with an outrageous accusation against somebody - in this case, his popular predecessor - without substantiation, thus planting that bit of false news in the minds of his supporters and also muddying the news narrative. No so-called leader of the GOP has the guts to call out Trump on his crude, cowardly accusation, and it simply sits there - another reprehensible lie in the barrage of lies that are rapidly corroding our democracy. Until McConnell, Ryan et al have the guts to come down hard on Trump for this sort of recklessness, which won't happen anytime soon, it will continue, and the country will slide closer to the status of a banana republic. Memo to Democrats: Where's the outrage?

Or perhaps, early signs of Alzheimer's or dementia. Some individuals in early stages are thoroughly convinced that certain people are "doing them in"
For example, In marriages, husband or wife with early dementia start to accuse the partner of infidelity. As the disease progresses, the bizzare accusations and behavior gets worse.
Psychologists call that projection. You ascribe to others exactly what you are doing yourself. Sad!
NO, the Times must report on all Trump's foolishness and make it part of the public record.
